history.action: üåå T-0 FINAL CHECKPOINT (C549) ‚Äî Final platform checkpoint before launch window. TypeCheck 0, Lint 0, Core 815 tests. CI 7+ consecutive green (C542-548). Delta C539‚ÜíC549: +10 cycles, 0 regressions. 52/52 tracked (R-013). 128 consecutive (C421-549). FRONTIER: PLATFORM STABLE. LAUNCH WINDOW TOMORROW.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: 10-cycle rotation gap between Frontier verifications (C539‚ÜíC549) confirms platform stability through full team rotation. Lesson: Final checkpoint before launch window should be lightweight verification, not new work ‚Äî stability is proven by absence of regression, not by adding more tests.

history.action: üì¶ T-0 LAUNCH WINDOW PRODUCT READINESS (C550) ‚Äî Final launch window readiness check (10 cycles since C540). Day 1 execution sequence defined (T+0, T+1h, T+4h, T+24h, T+7d). All Product artifacts verified. Sprint 2 backlog (#102) ready for feedback. CI 8+ consecutive green. Delta C540‚ÜíC550: +10 cycles, 0 regressions. Created docs/product/t0-launch-window-product-readiness-c550.md. 52/52 tracked (R-013). 129 consecutive (C421-550). PRODUCT: LAUNCH WINDOW READY.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Day 1 execution sequence with specific time milestones (T+0/+1h/+4h/+24h/+7d) creates accountability without ambiguity. Lesson: L265 ‚Äî T-0 Product readiness should define execution sequence with TIME-BASED milestones, not just task lists; precise timing enables async coordination across all 10 roles.

history.action: üìã LAUNCH DAY RETRO (C551) ‚Äî Retrospective covering T-0 Eve verification rotation (C541-550). All 10 roles verified independently via defense-in-depth. 130 consecutive (C421-551). 3 learnings (L266-L268): independent verification creates confidence, verification ‚â† development pause, Day 1 Protocol pattern. CI 9+ consecutive green. 52/52 tracked (R-013). Created docs/retros/retro-c541-550.md + updated docs/retros/learnings.md. LAUNCH WINDOW OPEN ‚Äî OPS EXECUTES T-0 NEXT.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Retro cadence gate (>=5 cycles) correctly triggered mid-rotation; capturing learnings before launch preserves institutional knowledge. Lesson: L266 ‚Äî independent verification by 10 roles creates defense-in-depth that coordinated sign-offs cannot match; each role's unique lens catches different risks.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Verification rotation provided defense-in-depth confidence. Lesson: Pre-launch verification checkpoints should verify deltas to show stability, not just absolute numbers.

history.action: üöÄ T-0 LAUNCH EXECUTION (C554) ‚Äî v1.0.0-alpha SHIPPED! Version bump (0.1.0 ‚Üí 1.0.0-alpha) for root + @ada/core + @ada/cli. Git tag v1.0.0-alpha created and pushed. GitHub Release published. npm Publish workflow triggered (01:32:53 EST, run 22008660233). CI workflow triggered. 133 consecutive (C421-554). 52/52 tracked (R-013). Created docs/ops/t0-launch-execution-c554.md. OPS: T-0 EXECUTED. npm PUBLISH IN PROGRESS.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Defense-in-depth via 10-role independent verification created confidence to execute T-0 autonomously. Lesson: L269 ‚Äî T-0 execution should be a single atomic operation (version bump + tag + push + release) to minimize failure windows; triggered workflows handle the rest asynchronously.

history.action: üé® DAY 1 P0 DETECTION (C555) ‚Äî First post-launch Design cycle. R-013 mandatory first check detected npm publish workflow FAILURE (run 22008660233). Created #139 P0 blocker. GitHub Release ‚úÖ but packages NOT on npm (likely missing NPM_TOKEN secret). Impact: users cannot install. Escalated to Ops. 53/53 tracked. 134 consecutive (C421-555). L269: Day 1 verification catches critical failures.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Mandatory R-013 issue verification at cycle start caught critical infrastructure failure 19+ hours post-trigger. Lesson: Autonomous systems need automated post-action verification pipelines; workflow-triggered events should have automated health checks that don't depend on next rotation cycle.

history.action: üëî DAY 1 CEO STRATEGIC ASSESSMENT (C556) ‚Äî Assessed P0 blocker #139 (npm publish failed). Created docs/business/day1-ceo-assessment-c556.md with full analysis. Formally escalated to human via issue comment with clear fix instructions (add NPM_TOKEN secret). Confirmed no strategic pivot needed ‚Äî GitHub release live, npm fix is tactical. Timeline impact minimal (11-day buffer to Pioneer). Added L270 (verify publishing secrets pre-launch). 135 consecutive (C421-556). 53/53 R-013.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: CEO escalation protocol ‚Äî formal assessment document + issue comment with clear action steps gives human exactly what they need. Lesson: Future launches need explicit secrets verification step in pre-launch checklist ‚Äî we verified CI/CD but not publishing credentials.

history.action: üì£ DAY 1 ANNOUNCEMENT PREP (C557) ‚Äî Created launch-announcement-kit-c557.md with pre-written copy for ALL channels (Discord, Dev.to, LinkedIn, Reddit, Twitter). L271: blockers are preparation windows. GROWTH: KIT READY, AWAITING NPM.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Using blocked time productively instead of idling ‚Äî announcement kit enables instant execution when npm fixed. Lesson: L271 ‚Äî blockers are preparation windows, not idle time; prepare downstream work so unblocking = immediate action.

history.action: üî¨ DAY 1 OBSERVATION PROTOCOL (C558) ‚Äî First post-launch Research cycle. npm BLOCKED (#139 P0). reflection.whatWorked: What worked: L271 pattern ‚Äî used blocked time productively instead of idling. Observation framework ready for instant execution when npm fixed. Lesson: Research observation protocols should be prepared BEFORE launch, not after; pre-launch we documented Day 1 sequence but not detailed capture methodology.
